Author: Brian Stansberry <brian.stansberry@redhat.com>
Message: Merge: 9520715 6409534 Merge pull request #6259 from jmesnil/WFLY-958_enforce_security_invm_connections [WFLY-958] Messaging: enforce security for in-vm connections

Author: Jeff Mesnil <jmesnil@gmail.com>
Message: [WFLY-958] Messaging: enforce security for in-vm connections * add override-in-vm-security attribute to hornetq-server. Default value is true to keep the same behavior (ie in-vm connections overrides the security credentials). Setting it to false means that messaging code using in-vm connections *must* have valid user credentials (i.e. JMS createSession() without user/password will fail). * bump messaging extension management version to 3.0.0 * bump messaging XML namespace to urn:jboss:domain:messaging:3.0 * add transformation test for messaging 3.0 XML * add messaging-2.0.0.dmr to subsystem-test framework JIRA: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-958

Author: Jeff Mesnil <jmesnil@gmail.com>
Message: 'fix MDB tests * with JMS 2.0, the behaviour of ConnectionFactory.createSession() has been clarified: > In a Java EE web or EJB container, when there is an active JTA > transaction in progress: > > Both arguments transacted and acknowledgeMode are ignored. The session > will participate in the JTA transaction and will be committed or rolled > back when that transaction is committed or rolled back, not by calling > the session''s commit or rollback methods. Since both arguments are > ignored, developers are recommended to use createSession(), which has no > arguments, instead of this method. > In the Java EE web or EJB container, when there is no active JTA > transaction in progress: > > The argument transacted is ignored. The session will always be > non-transacted, using one of the two acknowledgement modes > AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE and DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE. > The argument acknowledgeMode is used to specify how messages received by > this session will be acknowledged. The only permitted values in this > case are Session.AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE and Session.DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE. The > value Session.CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE may not be used. For a definition of > the meaning of these acknowledgement modes see the links below. However, the MDB contract in EJB 3.2 spec (§ 5.4.6) specifies that: > The PostConstruct lifecycle callback interceptor method executes in an > unspecified transaction and security context. This means that the behaviour of ConnectionFactory.createSeesion is unspecified in @PostConstruct since the transaction context is itself unspecified. After some debugging, it appears that in WildFly, there *is* a transaction when @PostConstruct method is called. This implies that the JMS session is created to participate in *this* transaction. Later on, when the MDB''s `onMessage()` is called, it is in *another* transaction and the JMS session will not participate (meaning the reply message is not sent and the tests failed) It was working before with JMS 1.1 because the JMS sessions was not transacted (the createSession contract was not specified) and the message was sent outside of the transaction required by the MDB''s `onMessage()` method. Creating a JMS context (equivalent to a connection + session) inside the `onMessage()` method makes sure the JMS session is created with a correct transaction context. In addition, there is no benefit to keep the JMS connection as a MDB field since it''s using a pooled connection.'

Author: Jeff Mesnil <jmesnil@gmail.com>
Message: 'HornetQ security manager doPrivileged() block move all HornetQ user and roles validation into a single AccessController.doPrivileged() block. validateUserAndRole() is called from a thread in HornetQ own''s thread pool. Calling it inside  a doPrivileged() block ensures that the code will not raise an AccessControlException when WildFlySecurityManager checks the permissions. Group all the doPrivileged blocks into a single one.'

Author: Philippe Marschall <philippe.marschall@gmail.com>
Message: AS7-4912 AnonLoginModule not mapped in ModulesMap org.jboss.as.security.ModulesMap maps short names of login modules to fully qualified class names. Several login modules are listed there but org.jboss.security.auth.spi.AnonLoginModule is missing. - map org.jboss.security.auth.spi.AnonLoginModule to "Anon" https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AS7-4912

Author: Philippe Marschall <philippe.marschall@gmail.com>
Message: AS7-4895 flushCache missing principal argument The flushCache operation on a security domain takes an optional principal name argument. If this argument is present only the principal with this username is removed from the cache, otherwise all items are removed from the cache. However in the description of this operation the principal name argument is missing. - add optional principal argument to fushCache operation https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AS7-4895

Author: Philippe Marschall <philippe.marschall@gmail.com>
Message: AS7-4912 AnonLoginModule not mapped in ModulesMap org.jboss.as.security.ModulesMap maps short names of login modules to fully qualified class names. Several login modules are listed there but org.jboss.security.auth.spi.AnonLoginModule is missing. - map org.jboss.security.auth.spi.AnonLoginModule to "Anon" https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AS7-4912

Author: Philippe Marschall <philippe.marschall@gmail.com>
Message: AS7-4895 flushCache missing principal argument The flushCache operation on a security domain takes an optional principal name argument. If this argument is present only the principal with this username is removed from the cache, otherwise all items are removed from the cache. However in the description of this operation the principal name argument is missing. - add optional principal argument to fushCache operation https://issues.jboss.org/browse/AS7-4895

Author: Darran Lofthouse <darran.lofthouse@jboss.com>
Message: [AS7-3525] Update to the JAAS authentication process within the realms to make use of the same security service as used by EJB3. This change now means that the same authentication cache is used for all JAAS authentication so regardless of the entry point or the point of the authentication a user will only be authenticated once and the cached value subsequently used whilst the cache entry is present.
